name: FastQC
description: A quality control tool for high throughput sequence data.

name: BLAST
description: Basic Local Alignment Search Tool for comparing nucleotide or protein sequences.

name: HISAT2
description: A fast and sensitive alignment program for mapping RNA-seq reads.

name: Cytoscape
description: An open-source platform for complex network analysis and visualization.

name: FlowJo
description: A software application with an integrated environment for viewing and analyzing flow cytometric data.

name: ImageJ
description: An open-source image processing program designed for scientific multidimensional images.

name: MATLAB
description: A programming and numeric computing platform used by engineers and scientists.

name: GraphPad Prism
description: A software program combining scientific graphing, comprehensive curve fitting, and data organization.

name: RStudio
description: An integrated development environment for R, a programming language for statistical computing and graphics.

name: GSEA
description: A computational method that determines whether an a priori defined set of genes shows statistically significant differences.

name: Galaxy
description: An open, web-based platform for accessible, reproducible, and transparent computational biomedical research.

name: CellProfiler
description: An open-source software for measuring and analyzing cell images.

name: SPSS
description: A powerful statistical software platform used for advanced statistical analysis.

name: MaxQuant
description: A quantitative proteomics software package designed for analyzing large mass spectrometric data.

name: OpenMS
description: An open-source software C++ library for LC-MS data management and analyses.

name: Qlucore Omics Explorer
description: Software for advanced data analysis and visualization in life science research.

name: QIIME 2
description: A next-generation microbiome bioinformatics platform that is extensible, free, and open source.

name: SRA Toolkit
description: A collection of tools and libraries for retrieving and formatting DNA sequence data.

name: Seurat
description: An R toolkit for single-cell genomics, designed to explore cellular heterogeneity.

name: TissueGnostics
description: Provides solutions for automated tissue image analysis.

name: AutoDock
description: A suite of automated docking tools designed to predict how small molecules bind to a receptor of known 3D structure.

name: PyMOL
description: A molecular visualization system with an open-source foundation, producing high-quality 3D images.

name: DeepLabCut
description: An open-source toolbox for markerless pose estimation of animals using deep learning.

name: Igor Pro
description: A software environment for experimentation with scientific and engineering data.

name: Bioconductor
description: An open-source project providing tools for the analysis and comprehension of high-throughput genomic data.

name: Bowtie
description: An ultrafast, memory-efficient short read aligner for aligning sequencing reads to long reference sequences.

name: Cufflinks
description: A program for transcriptome assembly and differential expression analysis of RNA-Seq data.

name: DESeq2
description: An R package to analyze count data from RNA-Seq experiments and test for differential expression.

name: IGV (Integrative Genomics Viewer)
description: A high-performance visualization tool for interactive exploration of large, integrated genomic datasets.

name: MAFFT
description: A multiple sequence alignment program for amino acid or nucleotide sequences.

name: MEGA
description: Molecular Evolutionary Genetics Analysis software for comparative analysis of homologous sequences.

name: Mothur
description: An open-source software package that enables processing of 16S rRNA gene sequences.

name: NanoPlot
description: A plotting tool for Oxford Nanopore sequencing data and associated QC files.

name: PLINK
description: A whole-genome association analysis toolset, designed to perform a range of basic, large-scale analyses in a computationally efficient manner.

name: Proteome Discoverer
description: A comprehensive software suite for analyzing qualitative and quantitative proteomics data.

name: PyTorch
description: An open-source machine learning library based on the Torch library, used for applications such as computer vision and natural language processing.

name: QIAGEN CLC Genomics Workbench
description: A software suite for analyzing, visualizing, and interpreting omics data.

name: Samtools
description: A suite of programs for interacting with high-throughput sequencing data, providing various utilities for manipulating alignments in the SAM format.

name: Scikit-learn
description: A Python module for machine learning built on SciPy, providing simple and efficient tools for data mining and data analysis.

name: StringTie
description: A fast and highly efficient assembler of RNA-Seq alignments into potential transcripts.

name: TopHat
description: A fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads that aligns RNA-Seq reads to mammalian-sized genomes.

name: Trimmomatic
description: A flexible read trimming tool for Illumina NGS data to remove adapters and low-quality bases.

name: VELVET
description: A set of algorithms optimized for short read sequencing data to assemble genomes.

name: WaveSurfer
description: A MATLAB software package for electrophysiological data acquisition and analysis.

name: WebGestalt
description: A functional enrichment analysis web tool, providing a way to identify biological functions related to a given gene list.

name: WEKA
description: A collection of machine learning algorithms for data mining tasks, featuring tools for data pre-processing, classification, regression, clustering, and more.

name: XCMS
description: A software platform for the analysis of LC/MS data including raw data processing and feature detection.

name: Zenodo
description: An open-access repository that enables researchers to share and preserve research outputs in any size, any format, and from any field of science.

name: Zotero
description: A free, easy-to-use tool to help you collect, organize, cite, and share research.

name: BioGRID
description: A curated database of protein and genetic interactions.

name: Bowtie 2
description: An ultrafast and memory-efficient tool for aligning sequencing reads to long reference sequences.

name: BWA
description: A software package for mapping low-divergent sequences against a large reference genome.

name: CLUMPP
description: A program that helps identify the optimal alignment of multiple population structure analyses.

name: Circos
description: A software package for visualizing data and information in a circular layout.

name: COBRA Toolbox
description: A MATLAB toolbox for constraint-based reconstruction and analysis of genome-scale metabolic models.

name: CONCOCT
description: A program for unsupervised binning of metagenomic contigs by clustering nucleotide composition and coverage.

name: CONSEL
description: A program for assessing the confidence of phylogenetic tree selection.

name: CUT&RUNTools
description: A pipeline for analyzing CUT&RUN sequencing data for profiling chromatin.

name: DEAP
description: A novel evolutionary computation framework for rapid prototyping and testing of ideas.

name: DIAMOND
description: An ultra-fast protein alignment tool for large-scale metagenomic protein searches.

name: DOGMA
description: A web-based program for annotating mitochondrial and chloroplast genome sequences.

name: Edgar
description: A platform for the comparative analysis of genomes with a focus on ortholog identification.

name: EDGE Bioinformatics
description: An open-source, user-friendly bioinformatics platform for various genomics and metagenomics analyses.

name: EIGENSOFT
description: A suite of programs for population genetics analyses using principal component analysis.

name: EMBOSS
description: A bioinformatics software package for the analysis of sequence data.

name: ENCoRE
description: A computational tool for analyzing enhancer RNAs using ChIP-Seq data.

name: EPIC
description: An algorithm for analyzing ChIP-seq data to identify regions of transcription factor binding.

name: Escher
description: A web-based visualization tool for genome-scale metabolic maps.

name: FASTX-Toolkit
description: A collection of command line tools for preprocessing short read sequences in FASTA/FASTQ format.

name: FELLA
description: An R package for enriched pathway analysis in metabolomics.

name: Fiji
description: A distribution of ImageJ focused on biological image analysis.

name: FLUXCAPACITOR
description: A software for quantifying the abundance of alternatively spliced isoforms in RNA-Seq data.

name: GATK (Genome Analysis Toolkit)
description: A toolkit for variant discovery in high-throughput sequencing data.

name: GeneMANIA
description: A web-based tool for predicting the function of genes and gene sets using functional interaction networks.

name: Geneious
description: A software platform for the organization and analysis of molecular biology data.

name: GEMMA
description: A software tool for genome-wide association analysis using a linear mixed model.

name: GEO2R
description: An online tool for comparing groups of samples in a GEO Series to identify differentially expressed genes.

name: GROMACS
description: A versatile package to perform molecular dynamics, i.e., simulate the Newtonian equations of motion for systems with hundreds to millions of particles.

name: GSEApy
description: A Python package for gene set enrichment analysis.

name: HTSeq
description: A Python package for processing and analyzing high-throughput sequencing data.

name: ImageJ
description: An open-source image processing program designed for scientific multidimensional images.

name: Infernal
description: A software package for RNA homology search and alignment using covariance models.

name: I-TASSER
description: A software suite for automated protein structure and function prediction.

name: Jalview
description: A free program for multiple sequence alignment editing, visualization, and analysis.

name: Kaiju
description: A program for taxonomic classification of high-throughput metagenomic sequencing reads.

name: KBase
description: An open-source software and data science platform designed for collaborative, systems biology research.

name: Kraken
description: An ultrafast and highly accurate program for assigning taxonomic labels to metagenomic DNA sequences.

name: Liftover
description: A tool for converting coordinates between different genome assemblies.

name: MAnorm
description: A normalization and comparison tool for ChIP-seq datasets.

name: MAUVE
description: A software tool for the alignment of conserved genomic sequences and the discovery of rearrangements.

name: MISO
description: A probabilistic framework for RNA-Seq analysis and quantification of alternative splicing events.

name: Molecular Operating Environment (MOE)
description: A comprehensive suite of tools for molecular modeling, simulation, and drug discovery.

name: Mothur
description: An open-source software package that enables processing of 16S rRNA gene sequences.

name: MultiQC
description: A tool to aggregate bioinformatics results across many samples into a single report.

name: NanoMod
description: A computational tool for identifying DNA modifications in nanopore sequencing data.

name: ncRNA-Predict
description: A tool for predicting non-coding RNA genes in genomic sequences.

name: ngs.plot
description: A tool for visualizing the enrichment of high-throughput sequencing signals.

name: Nextstrain
description: An open-source project to harness the scientific and public health potential of pathogen genome data.

name: OncoPrint
description: A tool for visualizing multiple genomic alterations in cancer research.

name: Partek Flow
description: A genomics analysis software designed to analyze next-generation sequencing data.

name: Picard
description: A set of command line tools for manipulating high-throughput sequencing (HTS) data and formats.

name: Plink2
description: A toolset for whole-genome association and population-based linkage analyses.

name: Prokka
description: A software tool for the rapid annotation of prokaryotic genomes.

name: PyRx
description: A Virtual Screening software for Computational Drug Discovery that can be used to screen libraries of compounds against potential drug targets.

name: QIIME 2
description: An open-source bioinformatics pipeline for performing microbiome analysis from raw DNA sequencing data.

name: Raven
description: A MATLAB toolbox for generating genome-scale metabolic models.

name: RSEM
description: An RNA-Seq transcript quantification software that estimates gene and isoform expression levels.

name: SAMtools
description: A suite of programs for interacting with high-throughput sequencing data.

name: SANSparallel
description: A software package for detecting protein domains and comparing their sequences.

name: Seurat
description: An R toolkit for single-cell genomics, designed to explore cellular heterogeneity.

name: Shiny
description: An R package that makes it easy to build interactive web apps straight from R.

name: SIFT
description: A program that predicts whether an amino acid substitution affects protein function.

name: SimBioNeT
description: A versatile bioinformatics pipeline for the analysis of microbiome and metagenomics data.

name: SPAdes

name: STRING
description: A database of known and predicted protein-protein interactions.

name: T-COFFEE

name: Taverna

name: TreeView
description: A program that provides a way to visualize hierarchical clustering results.

name: VMD
